page.title: 07Recreation In Chorley (1)
page.content: The main recreation park in Chorley is Astley Park which is situated in the centre of Chorley. It has football, rugby and cricket pitches. It also has a putting green and a bowling green. Recently a mini-zoo was added to its attractions.The main place of interest in the park is Astley Hall, an Elizabethan Hall which is open to the public as a museum.Oliver Cromwell is reported to have slept there. Chorley swimming baths is situated on Union Street. It has two well used pools one being solely for learner swimmers. The baths complex also houses four squash courts and Chorley Borough Council's ammenities department. A recent addition to the towns recreation facilities is the 'Sports Centre' which is currently being built on Water Street. It should be opened late 1985 or early 1986.
